name.description: A short human readable title used to refer to the repository in passing. Required if repository was created/modified after SHARE IT Act onset date. SHARE IT Act Clauses: Loosely, SEC 2 (5) (A)

description.description: A moderate length human readable explanation used to help people who are unfamiliar with the repository to understand its purpose. Required if repository was created/modified after SHARE IT Act onset date. SHARE IT Act Clauses: Loosely, SEC 2 (5) (A)

lastModified.description: Date the repository was last modified (ISO-8601 format). SHARE IT Act Clauses: SEC 3 (d)(2)(A)(b)(ii), SEC 7

visibility.description: Whether access to the source code is open to the public, to any federal employee, or restricted to a private group of authorized users based on an approved exemption from OCIO. SHARE IT Act Clauses: SEC 2 (5) (B) (i) (II)

exemptionUrl.description: URL of the OCIO-approved exemption that prohibits sharing this repository. SHARE IT Act Clauses: SEC 2 (5) (B) (i) (II)

url.description: Hyperlink to the repository in which the code is shared, whether public or private. SHARE IT Act Clauses: SEC 2 (5) (B) (iii)

contractAwardUrls.description: List of USASpending.gov award URLs or null if unknown. Providing an empty list [] means that it has been positively affirmed that the custom-developed code and other key technical components in the repository were NOT produced pursuant to a contract. SHARE IT Act Clauses: SEC 2 (5) (B) (ii), SEC 2 (5) (B) (i) (II), SEC 7

feedbackMechanism.description: Description of how to contribute or provide feedback. SHARE IT Act Clauses: SEC 3 (d)(2)(A)(b)(iii)

pointOfContact.description: Email address for repository inquiries. SHARE IT Act Clauses: None
